title: Product Security Flaw Metadata
description: Metadata related to Flaws that Product Security tracks.

public.description: A UTC ISO 8601 formated Date or Datetime of when the Flaw became (or becomes) public

reported.description: A UTC ISO 8601 formated Date or Datetime of when the Flaw was reported

source.description: Where did the Flaw report come from

cvss2.description: The CVSS 2 score/vector for the Flaw

cvss3.description: The CVSS 3 score/vector for the Flaw

cvss3_comment.description: Comment of RH CVSS 3 scoring primarily targeted to explain differences from NVD scoring

cwe.description: The CWE rating of the Flaw

statement.description: This is Red Hat's official statement on this Flaw for customers.

mitigation.description: Tracks the steps or countermeasures that can be taken by our customers to mitigate the Flaw or lower its potential impact.

mitigate.description: Specifies technologies/countermeasures that mitigate or completely neutralize the security impact of the Flaw

classification.description: The Flaw's classification level. Currently only holds the value 'secret' for Flaws we need to handle extra carefully, may be extended later.

affects.description: A list of affects entries where we define what is affected and what is not

references.description: A list of URL references that include type information

exploits.description: A list of exploits gathered from various sources

acks_not_needed.description: Determine whether an acknowledgment is needed for the flaw or not

prestage_eligible_date.description: A UTC ISO 8601 formated Date or Datetime of when Flaw and mainly their Trackers can be prestaged in CPaaS environment

name.description: The name of the person or entity being acknowledged.

affiliation.description: The affiliation of the person being acknowledged.

from_upstream.description: Whether this acknowledgment comes an upstream source.

name.description: Name or ID of the exploit, according to the source

summary.description: A short summary of an exploit

cvss3_temporal_metrics.description: The CVSS 3 temporal metrics vector for exploit

last_updated.description: A UTC ISO 8601 formatted Datetime of when the source was updated

first_seen.description: A UTC ISO 8601 formatted Datetime of when the record was set on the Flaw

disclosure_date.description: A UTC ISO 8601 formatted Datetime of when the exploit was publicly disclosed

template.description: The id of the checklist template this was created from

signature.description: A fingerprint of the template so we can easily tell when it has changed

items.description: The list of Checklist Items in this checklist

checked.description: Whether the item is checked or not

item.description: The description of the item itself

not_applicable.description: Whether the item is applicable in this case or not

ps_module.description: The PsModule of the product in question

ps_component.description: The PsComponent (package) in question. May also include module information

affectedness.description: Whether it is affected or not. A state of 'new' indicates it has not yet been analyzed, 'none' is for historic data

resolution.description: The resolution we determined we need to pursue

impact.description: An impact that overrides the Flaw-specific one in this case

cvss2.description: A CVSS 2 score/vector that overrides the Flaw-specific one in this case

cvss3.description: A CVSS 3 score/vector that overrides the Flaw-specific one in this case

sla_exception.description: A pair of [PsUpdateStream, PsComponent] that should be considered 'not under sla'

key.description: JIRA issue key in given JIRA instance
